intro: Gossypium tricuspidatum var. oligospermum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and related plants. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
